entry.title: my training record
entry.content:
Postcard Material

Organize and Expand My Fitness Content (Translated to English)

First Training Session

@LUNA This is your reminder for todayâ€™s session:

  • Session Type: Regular Class
  • Time: 6:15 PM
  • Duration: 60 minutes
  • Focus: Pelvic Structure Improvement + Cardio
  • Reminder: Bring your workout gear, eat a light meal 1 hour before training to maintain muscle endurance. [Post-Workout Feedback]
  • Todayâ€™s Focus: Back + Cardio

Highlights of This Session:
âœ” Lat Pulldown â€“ Excellent engagement of the teres major and latissimus dorsi, full range of motion with proper lat stretch. ğŸ‘
âœ” V-Bar Pulldown â€“ Stable and controlled movement, great lat activation. ğŸ‘
âœ” Cardio Training â€“ Completed with good intensity and proper energy expenditure without overexertion.

Post-Session Notes:

  • Maintain consistent training to improve endurance and build a foundation for future cardio sessions.
  • Adjust your dietâ€”avoid high-calorie meals at night.

Second Training Session

[Wednesday Post-Workout Feedback]
Todayâ€™s Focus: Shoulders + Fat-Burning

Highlights of This Session:
âœ” Smith Machine Shoulder Press â€“ Empty bar, 4 sets âœ…
âœ” 2kg Lateral Raises + Resistance Band â€“ 20 reps, 4 sets âœ…
âœ” 2.5kg Face Pulls â€“ 4 sets âœ…
âœ” Crunches â€“ 25 reps, 2 sets âœ…
âœ” Medicine Ball Press â€“ 30 sec, 3 sets âœ…

Areas for Improvement:

  • Muscle strength and endurance need work.
  • Cardio capacity requires further development.
  • Consistency will lead to progress.

Post-Session Notes:

  • Keep meals lightâ€”low oil, salt, and carbs.
  • Increase protein intake for balanced nutrition.
  • Get enough rest!

Third Training Session

[Post-Workout Feedback]
Todayâ€™s Focus: Glute Training

Highlights of This Session:
âœ” Seated Hip Abduction (Adjusted Form) â€“ Successfully targeted the upper glutes, better mind-muscle connection. ğŸ‘
âœ” Hip Thrusts â€“ Quick learning progress, strong activation of the mid-lower glutes.
âœ” Cardio Training â€“ Excellent performance, noticeable improvement in endurance and fitness level!

Post-Session Notes:

  • A slight feeling of hunger before bed can aid fat loss.
  • Stay consistentâ€”progress is guaranteed with persistence!

Would you like any refinements or additional details? ğŸ˜Š

entry.title: about my postcard
entry.content:
1.Qingdao is a beautiful coastal city in eastern Chinaâ€™s Shandong Province, known for its beaches, seafood, and German-style architecture. Once a German colony, it still preserves historic buildings like St. Michaelâ€™s Cathedral and old villas in Badaguan. The city is famous for Tsingtao Beer, brewed since 1903, and hosts the vibrant Qingdao International Beer Festival every summer. Nature lovers enjoy Mount Laoshan, a scenic Taoist mountain. With a mix of tradition and modern industry, Qingdao is also home to major companies like Haier. Its charm, culture, and ocean views make it a popular destination for both tourists and business travelers.

2.I just created an Instagram account yesterday to connect with people for postcard exchanges. However, after sending a few DMs, my account was suddenly restricted. I immediately submitted an appeal and anxiously waited, assuming I might lose the account for good. To my surprise, it was restored within an hour! The experience made me cautiousâ€”Iâ€™ll avoid aggressive liking or messaging for now.
Work has been quiet today, with little on my plate. I considered sourcing some products, but many items are hard to find reliable Chinese suppliers for, as theyâ€™re rarely manufactured locally.
This week, Iâ€™m excited to attend a collaborative postcard-design event in Chengduâ€”my first time joining such a meetup! I look forward to meeting fellow enthusiasts and brainstorming creative ideas together.

3.7. This morning, I had one egg and half a boiled cornâ€”very light. I almost finished reading the diaries I wrote during college on WPS and gained some new insights. Not sure if I should wash my hair tonight. I also plan to continue writing postcards, which is quite time-consumingâ€”even pre-made ones take a long time to copy. After revisiting the content I wrote when setting up my blog, I feel like blogging again. Hiring a programmer on Xianyu to build a website costs 50 RMB, but Iâ€™d still need to buy a domain and use Alibaba Cloud, which feels like a hassle. Maintenance later would also cost money. My Qingdao postcards were selected, so I can only send five to that netizen. How many non-boxed postcards should I give as compensation? No new Postcrossing email notifications in my inbox yet. Recently, I mailed the postcards that already had stamps. It was a bit chilly this morning, but I managed to follow yesterdayâ€™s plan: dress warmly, bring an umbrella, and carry sanitary padsâ€”all done in the short time before leaving.

In the evening, I biked to the Incubation Park while listening to Fujii Kazeâ€™s music. Why is â€œShiroiâ€ so popular with so many likes? Itâ€™s way too overhypedâ€”I think itâ€™s just okay. The sunlight during the ride made it a bit warm. Both today and yesterday, colleagues ate ice creamâ€”was it really that hot? Though some people eat ice cream even in winter. Vickie treated us to some premium-brand ice cream. So many people got on at Century City Station. Yesterday, four colleagues passed their probation period, and today Lily treated us to afternoon tea. I ordered a strawberry milkshake, which was pretty goodâ€”a mix of crushed ice and strawberry bits. I asked for half sugar because Iâ€™m worried about the health effects of too much sugar, but my colleagues said itâ€™s fine as long as you donâ€™t drink it daily. Some prefer full sugar, while others are even more sugar-averse than meâ€”one found half sugar too sweet since there was no 30% sugar option.

Iâ€™m tempted to mention on Postcrossing that I like Fujii Kazeâ€”what if I meet a fellow fan? Even after arriving at Haichang Road Station, there were still many people left. Meimei Yao Facai was curiously asking about the 2.8 RMB hat I bought, lol. Today, I reviewed about 10-20 Japanese grammar points but havenâ€™t finished the N1 material yetâ€”probably will tomorrow. Bringing a book was definitely useful. Saw that Hainan University made it into the top 100 of the Soft Science rankingsâ€”so gratifying, though itâ€™s out of my league academically. Hope they recruit even better talent this year. The newly constructed building looks really nice. My coach asked me to do cardio today, but Iâ€™ll go tomorrowâ€”working out takes too much time.

Feeling like my period might be comingâ€”my underwear feels damp, but no stomach pain. Thinking of using Twitter to find postcard pals and Instagram to connect with Japanese people. I want to practice Japanese more since writing daily logs in English has already improved my English skills. Arrived at Xibocheng Station by 18:37â€”so fast! Remembered how a woman rushed into the train yesterday and almost got caught in the doors. I was so startled I yelled, â€œDonâ€™t come in!â€

entry.title: farm
entry.content: We went to the countryside to plant peanuts today. The breeze was cool and refreshing, but I just stood by and watched as they worked the fields. My dad was using a needle to inject liquid into a tree, causing it to die. We bought two kilograms of peanuts, and after planting, only a few taels remained. They were planted on a slope, and my grandmother hoed the ground, her face dripping with sweat.here is the farm we worked on.
